授業目的: The purpose of this course is to provide students with knowledge of the challenges and policy responses to the Japanese economy in the face of declining birthrates, an aging population, and economic globalization, as well as an interest in and understanding of related economic theory. We will study the Japanese socio-economic policies of the second Abe administration (10% consumption tax, free early childhood education, promotion of the SDGs, etc.), which lasted about seven years and eight months, to gain a basic knowledge of the Japanese economy.
到達目標:
By taking part in the class actively, students are expected to
- get used to the lectures conducted in English,
- be able to prepare the presentation materials on the relevant topics of the Japanese economy, and
- be familiar with the whitepapers and statistics offered by the government.
授業方法: This course will be changed to an on-demand format to prevent infection of COVID-19. Students are required to submit a brief report on a topic covered in the 3rd and 4th period every Friday (7 brief reports in total), and the total score will determine their grades. Lecture addresses will be announced on LUNA.
